subject: Learning
title: The Danger of Labels
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Danger of Labels.

hook.text: 'I'm not a math person.' A student said this at age 9 and believed it for life.

buildup.text: Labeling students as a 'type' of learner can become a self-fulfilling prophecy.

discovery.text: When students believe they can only learn one way, they avoid challenges that don't fit their label.

twist.text: The label becomes an excuse: 'I failed because I'm kinesthetic and the lesson was visual.'

climax.text: Removing labels and teaching growth mindset opens doors that labels closed.

quiz.question: How can learning style labels harm students?
options: They create self-fulfilling limitations on how students approach challenges
They motivate students to try harder
They are always accurate and helpful
